gobblin.source

Class DatePartitionedAvroFileSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.source.extractor.extract.AbstractSource<S,D>
      • gobblin.source.extractor.filebased.FileBasedSource<Schema,GenericRecord>
        • gobblin.source.DatePartitionedAvroFileSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Source<Schema,GenericRecord>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatePartitionedDailyAvroSource

    public class DatePartitionedAvroFileSource
extends FileBasedSource<Schema,GenericRecord>
    Implementation of Source that reads over date-partitioned Avro data. This source can be regarded as the reader equivalent of TimeBasedAvroWriterPartitioner.

    The class will iterate through all the data folders given by the base directory ConfigurationKeys.SOURCE_FILEBASED_DATA_DIRECTORY and the partitioning type DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_PARTITION_PATTERN or DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_PARTITION_GRANULARITY

    For example, if the base directory is set to /my/data/ and daily partitioning is used, then it is assumed that /my/data/daily/[year]/[month]/[day] is present. It will iterate through all the data under these folders starting from the date specified by DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_MIN_WATERMARK_VALUE until either DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_MAX_FILES_PER_JOB files have been processed, or until there is no more data to process. For example, if DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_MIN_WATERMARK_VALUE is set to 2015/01/01, then the job will read from the folder /my/data/daily/2015/01/02/, /my/data/daily/2015/01/03/, /my/data/2015/01/04/ etc. When partitions contain pre/suffixes in the form of /my/data/prefix/[year]/[month]/[day]/suffix, one can refer to them via the DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_PARTITION_PREFIX and DATE_PARTITIONED_SOURCE_PARTITION_SUFFIX properties.

    The class will only process data in Avro format.

      • getWorkunits

        public List<WorkUnit> getWorkunits(SourceState state)
        Description copied from class: FileBasedSource
        This method takes the snapshot seen in the previous run, and compares it to the list of files currently in the source - it then decided which files it needs to pull and distributes those files across the workunits; it does this comparison by comparing the names of the files currently in the source vs. the names retrieved from the previous state
        Specified by:
        getWorkunits in interface Source<Schema,GenericRecord>
        Overrides:
        getWorkunits in class FileBasedSource<Schema,GenericRecord>
        Parameters:
        state - is the source state
        Returns:
        a list of workunits for the framework to run
